grammarModel.structure

Interface ISyntacticGrove

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, ISyntacticBranch, ISyntacticStructure
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SyntacticGrove

    public interface ISyntacticGrove
extends ISyntacticBranch
    ISyntacticGrove is a container of syntactic trees, i.e. syntactic branches whose name is the start element of the context-free grammar at use.
    Author:
    Gael Tregouet

    • Method Detail

      • getListOfComponents

        java.util.List<ISyntacticStructure> getListOfComponents()
        Specified by:
        getListOfComponents in interface ISyntacticStructure
        Returns:
        the list of component structures. The composition relationship between ISyntacticStructure objects being an equivalent to the derivation relationship between nodes of a syntactic tree, component structures represent the nodes of a syntactic tree that are directly derived from the generating node of this structure (the one that gives this structure its name).

      • markRedundancies

        void markRedundancies()
        Description copied from interface: ISyntacticStructure
        Looks for redundancies in this structure components, sub-components, etc. A syntactic structure R is redundant if it is a component of a structure A, and if another component of A contains a similar structure R'. Put another way : a syntactic structure R is redundant if it is a component of a structure A, and if the string of terminals generated by R is included in the string of terminal generated by another component of A.
        Specified by:
        markRedundancies in interface ISyntacticStructure

      • setPosetElementID

        void setPosetElementID()
                throws GrammarModelException
        Provides each tree and tree component, sub component, etc., with a 'poset element ID'. In order to make sure that two nodes with the same name and same derivation in the syntactic tree aren't provided with different 'poset element ID', syntactic chains generated by every structure in the grove are first collected and mapped with a unique ID. This map is then re-injected in the structure, so that every structure receives an ID accordingly to the list of chains it is associated with. Since two nodes with the same name and same derivation generate the same list of chains, this procedure guarantees that they also share the same 'poset element ID', and refer subsequently to a unique poset element.
        Parameters:
        chainsToIndex - a map that associates syntactic chains with a unique ID.
        Throws:
        GrammarModelException
